    Crops allocation with mixed constraints

    CropsMixedConstraints.Rmd
    library(ram)

    Problem Statement

    A Mediterranean farm plans to allocate land to 4 winter crops:

    • Gramineae: Oat, Barley

    • Legumes: Fava bean, Lupin

    ##Scenario:

    Oat: 2 ≤ area ≤ 8 ha

    Barley: 1 ≤ area ≤ 6 ha

    Fava bean: 3 ≤ area ≤ 7 ha

    Lupin: 0 ≤ area ≤ 5 ha

    Total land available: 15 ha

    Objective: Maximize total gross margin (profit)

    Assume gross margin per ha (example values, EUR/ha):

    • Oat: 400

    • Barley: 380

    • Fava bean: 450

    • Lupin: 420

    • Objective: Maximize total gross margin.

    Step 1: Define Resource Constraints (flexible min/max for each crop) 

    # Step 1: Define Resource Constraints (flexible min/max for each crop)
resources <- define_resources(
  resources = c(
    "land_total",
    "oat_min", "oat_max",
    "barley_min", "barley_max",
    "fava_min", "fava_max",
    "lupin_min", "lupin_max"
  ),
  availability = c(
    15,     # land_total
    2, 8,   # oat min/max
    1, 6,   # barley min/max
    3, 7,   # fava bean min/max
    0, 5    # lupin min/max
  ),
  direction = c(
    "<=",   # land_total
    ">=", "<=",
    ">=", "<=",
    ">=", "<=",
    ">=", "<="
  )
)
print(resources)
#>     resource availability direction
#> 1 land_total           15        <=
#> 2    oat_min            2        >=
#> 3    oat_max            8        <=
#> 4 barley_min            1        >=
#> 5 barley_max            6        <=
#> 6   fava_min            3        >=
#> 7   fava_max            7        <=
#> 8  lupin_min            0        >=
#> 9  lupin_max            5        <=

    Step 2: Define Activities (Crop Choices) 

    # Step 2: Define Activities (Crop Choices)
# Step 2: Define Activities
activity_requirements_matrix <- matrix(
  c(
    1, 1, 1, 1,    # land_total
    1, 0, 0, 0,    # oat_min
    1, 0, 0, 0,    # oat_max
    0, 1, 0, 0,    # barley_min
    0, 1, 0, 0,    # barley_max
    0, 0, 1, 0,    # fava_min
    0, 0, 1, 0,    # fava_max
    0, 0, 0, 1,    # lupin_min
    0, 0, 0, 1     # lupin_max
  ),
  nrow = 9, byrow = TRUE,
  dimnames = list(
    c(
      "land_total",
      "oat_min", "oat_max",
      "barley_min", "barley_max",
      "fava_min", "fava_max",
      "lupin_min", "lupin_max"
    ),
    c("oat", "barley", "fava", "lupin")
  )
)
print(activity_requirements_matrix)
#>            oat barley fava lupin
#> land_total   1      1    1     1
#> oat_min      1      0    0     0
#> oat_max      1      0    0     0
#> barley_min   0      1    0     0
#> barley_max   0      1    0     0
#> fava_min     0      0    1     0
#> fava_max     0      0    1     0
#> lupin_min    0      0    0     1
#> lupin_max    0      0    0     1

gross_margin <- c(400, 380, 430, 420)

activities <- define_activities(
  activities = c("oat", "barley", "fava", "lupin"),
  activity_requirements_matrix = activity_requirements_matrix,
  objective = gross_margin
)
print(activities)
#>        activity land_total oat_min oat_max barley_min barley_max fava_min
#> oat         oat          1       1       1          0          0        0
#> barley   barley          1       0       0          1          1        0
#> fava       fava          1       0       0          0          0        1
#> lupin     lupin          1       0       0          0          0        0
#>        fava_max lupin_min lupin_max objective
#> oat           0         0         0       400
#> barley        0         0         0       380
#> fava          1         0         0       430
#> lupin         0         1         1       420

    Step 3: Build and Solve the Model 

    # Step 3: Build and Solve the Model
model <- create_ram_model(resources, activities)
solution <- solve_ram(model, direction = "max")

    Step 4: Results 

    summary_ram(solution)
    cat("Maximum gross margin (EUR):", solution$objective_value, "\n")
#> Maximum gross margin (EUR): 6290
    plot_ram(solution)
